p: The free-radical scavenging activity of 1 and 2 in relation to the 2,2-diphenyl-1-picrylhydrazyl (DPPH) radical was measured using the colorimetric method described by Brand-Williams (1995), and the results are expressed in mg of ascorbic acid equivalent per 100 g of material (AAE/100 g) [ 26]. To evaluate the capacity of hydrogen atom transfer (HAT) of the isolated compounds, male Wistar rat brain homogenate was used as substrate for the production of thiobarbituric acid reactive substances (TBARS) produced by Fe 2+-induced oxidation undertaken at 37 Â°C, following the experimental conditions described elsewhere [ 27]. The inhibition of lipid peroxidation was expressed as % of inhibition. The animal protocol was approved by the Ethics Committee (UEPG, protocol 47/2017).
